questions.clue: For 200: In 1492, this explorer set sail on behalf of Spain and anchored in the New World.
For 400: Known for his travels in China, he became famous for his book detailing his journeys, inspiring future explorers like Columbus.
For 600: This Portuguese explorer was the first to reach India by sea, opening a maritime route from Europe to Asia in 1498.
For 800: This expedition, led by Ferdinand Magellan and completed by Juan Sebastián Elcano, achieved the first circumnavigation of the globe.
For 1000: In 1648, this Russian explorer led an expedition that proved Siberia was not connected to North America.
A legendary Canadian player famous for his number 99, he joined the Hall of Fame in 1999 without the customary waiting period.
This 'Russian Rocket' was inducted into the Hall of Fame in 2012, known for his stint with the Vancouver Canucks.
This Swedish defenseman was the first European-born captain to win the Stanley Cup in 1989 and joined the Hall in 1993.
Inducted in 2017, this Czech player is one of the few to win an Olympic gold, a World Championship, and a Stanley Cup.
The first European-trained player to be inducted into the Hall of Fame, he helped break the barrier in 1981.

categories.name: Science Fiction Worlds of the Future

questions.clue: In this series by Douglas Adams, the Earth is destroyed to make way for a hyperspace bypass.
questions.answer: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

questions.clue: This 1968 Philip K. Dick novel, adapted into a famous film, explores a dystopian Los Angeles where androids are hunted.
questions.answer: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?

questions.clue: In this William Gibson novel, credited with starting the cyberpunk genre, the concept of 'cyberspace' was popularized.
This future-set novel by Kazuo Ishiguro imagines a British society where cloned children are raised for organ donation.
Stanislaw Lem's classic 1961 novel explores the mysteries of a sentient ocean on the distant planet of Solaris.
This creamy Italian dish is made with Arborio rice and often flavored with parmesan cheese.
Named after a city in England, this traditionally hand-raised meat pie is often served cold.
Spain is famous for this saffron-infused rice dish, traditionally cooked in a large pan.
This French dish from Burgundy combines beef with red wine, mushrooms, and onions.
Originating in Hungary, this stew uses paprika as a main seasoning and often includes dumplings.
This French author wrote '20,000 Leagues Under the Sea' about Captain Nemo and his submarine, the Nautilus.
'The War of the Worlds', a novel about a Martian invasion of Earth, was written by this English scientist and author.
In 'Brave New World', this author envisions a dystopian future controlled by technology and a strict caste system.
'Solaris', a novel set on a planet covered by a sentient ocean, was penned by this Polish writer.
This Czech writer introduced the word 'robot' to describe artificial beings in his play 'R.U.R.' (Rossum's Universal Robots).

final.clue: This European capital, famously divided for years, is the setting for the climax of Philip K. Dick's novel 'The Man in the High Castle'.
